page.title: 04 TWO ARABLE FARMS - WEST ROW
page.content: BANK FARM IS AN ARABLE FARM OF SOME 142 ACRES BORDERING ON THE RIVER LARK. THE LAND IS LOW-LYING BUT WELL DRAINED. THIS FARM IS COUNCIL-OWNED AND HIRED TO THE PRESENT FARMER,WHO LIVES IN THE VILLAGE TWO MILES AWAY,THE OLD,ISOLATED FARMHOUSE HAVING BEEN PULLED DOWN. THE MAIN CROPS ARE POTATOES,CARROTS AND WHEAT.THE BUSIEST TIME OF THE YEAR ON THIS FARM IS SEPTEMBER/OCTOBER WHEN THE POTATOES ARE BEING LIFTED. OWERS FARM IS ALSO AN ARABLE FARM OF SOME 105 ACRES MOST OF WHICH IS GOOD,FREE-DRAINING SOIL.THE MAIN CROPS ARE WHEAT,SUGAR BEET,POTATOES,ONIONS AND CARROTS. AUGUST TILL CHRISTMAS IS THE BUSY TIME ON OWERS FARM DURING WHICH TIME THE WHEAT IS HARVESTED,THE POTATOES AND BEET ARE LIFTED AND THE WINTER CEREAL CROP IS DRILLED.
